title: American_Top_40_1976_January_10th
description:
"From the Great Lakes to the Rio Grande, you hear the nation's biggest hits every week at this time on American Top 40. My name is Casey Kasem and the countdown continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is the current single by the only British super-group to continue making the charts for more than 10 years after they first hit, without a change in membership.

Casey tells about the first song to hit number 1 on both the pop and soul charts, by a man who cried his way to success.

There is a song by the first solo artist in the rock era to hit the top 40 with two completely different arrangements of the same song, and released more than a decade apart.

Casey also answers the questions:

Has there ever been a time when all the top 10 songs were by female artists?

Has there ever been a week where no new songs have debuted into the top 40?

What male singer and what female singer have had the longest running chart records?

And a listener wants to know which motion picture soundtrack album has spent the most weeks on the LP chart. Casey says that album was written by the same two composers who also wrote the albums in 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place, and gives the details.
